result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Gerald Conover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Patrick Gerald Conover

Defendant Patrick Gerald Conover in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:07 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State recites plea agreement.  State moved to amend to 947.01(1) enhancer deleted.  Defendant entered plea of no contest to amended charge.  Court questions defendant as to plea questionnaire.  Court finds defendant guilty.
COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - fine/costs $579.00 - AODA and any follow thru - absolute sobriety

No abusive Contact with  -  JOSEPH CONOVER
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "  JOSEPH CONOVER  " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
